headline.print_headline: Islands Reflect Japanese Fear Of China’s Rise
headline.seo: Dispute Over Islands Reflects Japanese Fear of China’s Rise
headline.main: Dispute Over Islands Reflects Japanese Fear of China’s Rise

docs.snippet: A chain of islands at the center of a territorial dispute has Japanese nationalists pushing their country to boldly counter the explosive growth of China and South Korea....
docs.abstract: Small number of Japanese nationalists are pushing their country to boldly counter the explosive economic growth of China and South Korea by exploiting the evolving territorial dispute over the Senkaku Islands, small island chain in the East China Sea; nationalists have gained traction by taking advantage of the government's political weakness and of widespread anxiety over China.
docs.lead_paragraph: A chain of islands at the center of a territorial dispute has Japanese nationalists pushing their country to boldly counter the explosive growth of China and South Korea.

headline.print_headline: A Promise Unfulfilled at an Art Deco Bathhouse in the Rockaways
headline.seo: Jacob Riis Bathhouse, Envisioned as Park Centerpiece, Looks Abandoned
headline.main: A Promise Unfulfilled at an Art Deco Bathhouse in the Rockaways

docs.snippet: Renovation work began in the 1990s on the bathhouse at Jacob Riis Park in the Rockaways, but was never finished....
docs.abstract: Renovation work that began in the 1990s on an Art Deco bathhouse at Jacob Riis Park in the Rockaways has never been finished, much to the frustration of the public; nearly $20 million was spent on the 40,000-square-foot bathhouse before the project was seemingly abandoned; Gateway National Recreation Area officials are hopeful that recent agreement between National Park Service and New York City to jointly manage city and federal parks could mean a source of funding to complete renovations.
docs.lead_paragraph: Renovation work began in the 1990s on the bathhouse at Jacob Riis Park in the Rockaways, but was never finished.

docs.snippet: We need more than debates from our politicians. Just imagine what could be accomplished if the moderates were in charge instead of the radicals....
docs.abstract: Thomas L Friedman Op-Ed column laments the fact that a thoughtful and credible conservative opposition to Pres Obama does not exist; posits that if the Republican Party were controlled by moderates instead of extremists, the presidential election of 2012 would be centered on important issues.
docs.lead_paragraph: We need more than debates from our politicians. Just imagine what could be accomplished if the moderates were in charge instead of the radicals.

headline.print_headline: A Peacock Wanders Queens, Undeterred and Unclaimed
headline.main: A Peacock Wanders Queens, Undeterred and Unclaimed

docs.snippet: Residents of Kew Gardens Hills have been spotting the bird all week, but the Queens Zoo didn’t lose a peafowl and neither did the Botanical Garden....
docs.abstract: Kew Gardens Hills, Queens, residents report that a peacock has been wandering the area's streets, largely free of prying cameras or fawning attention, for nearly a week; Animal Care and Control of NYC employees, along with reporters, have had no success in spotting the bird, but it is apparently not an urban legend--many neighbors have been quick to offer photographic proof.
docs.lead_paragraph: Residents of Kew Gardens Hills have been spotting the bird all week, but the Queens Zoo didn’t lose a peafowl and neither did the Botanical Garden.

headline.print_headline: Report Finds Prosecutions At a Low Rate In the Bronx
headline.seo: Criminal Prosecutions at a Low Rate in the Bronx, a Report Finds
headline.main: Criminal Prosecutions at a Low Rate in the Bronx, a Report Finds

docs.snippet: The percentage of cases that the Bronx declines to prosecute has increased sharply since Robert T. Johnson, the district attorney, took office in 1989....
docs.abstract: Local public radio station WNYC issues report showing that the percentage of criminal cases that Bronx prosecutors decline to pursue has increased sharply since district attorney Robert T Johnson took office in 1989; report indicates that Johnson declined to pursue 23.4 percent of criminal cases in 2011, but only 1.5 percent in 1989.
docs.lead_paragraph: The percentage of cases that the Bronx declines to prosecute has increased sharply since Robert T. Johnson, the district attorney, took office in 1989.

headline.print_headline: Patients Would Pay More if Romney Restores Medicare Savings, Analysts Say
headline.seo: Costs Seen in Romney’s Medicare Savings Plan
headline.main: Patients Would Pay More if Romney Restores Medicare Savings, Analysts Say

docs.snippet: The $716 billion that Mitt Romney has promised to restore to hospitals and insurers would hasten the program’s insolvency, some experts say....

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Some health care experts say the $716 billion that Mitt Romney has promised to restore to hospitals and insurers would hasten Medicare's insolvency by eight years, to 2016 from 2024; say restoring reimbursement cuts would add hundreds of dollars a year to out-of-pocket expenses for beneficiaries.
docs.lead_paragraph: The $716 billion that Mitt Romney has promised to restore to hospitals and insurers would hasten the program’s insolvency, some experts say.

headline.print_headline: Inflammatory Risks of Syrian Intervention Limit Options for U.S.
headline.seo: Risks of Syrian Intervention Limit Options for U.S.
headline.main: Risks of Syrian Intervention Limit Options for U.S.

docs.snippet: The options for military action remain limited by what administration officials have described as a simple calculus: it would make the conflict worse....

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: News analysis; options for an American military intervention in Syria are limited by the risk of escalating the conflict; Obama administration officials have said that such an intervention could draw in Syria's patrons, principally Iran and Russia, and allow Pres Bashar al-Assad to rally popular support against the West.

byline.original: By STEVEN LEE MYERS and SCOTT SHANE

docs.lead_paragraph: The options for military action remain limited by what administration officials have described as a simple calculus: it would make the conflict worse.

headline.print_headline: Uncertain Future for the Gray Wolf
headline.seo: Uncertain Future for the Gray Wolf
headline.main: Uncertain Future for the Gray Wolf

docs.snippet: The federal government is about to strike a wolf management plan with Wyoming. But whether it’s enough to guarantee a sustainable population is far from clear....
docs.abstract: Editorial warns that Wyoming's population of gray wolves is at risk; contends that the fate of Wyoming's gray wolves will depend on the federal government's willingness to monitor, and revise if necessary, the wolf management plan it is about to strike with the state.
docs.lead_paragraph: The federal government is about to strike a wolf management plan with Wyoming. But whether it’s enough to guarantee a sustainable population is far from clear.

docs.snippet: The Supreme Court should take a case for review to reaffirm the Hyde Amendment, a federal law that checks against gross misconduct by federal prosecutors....
docs.abstract: Editorial urges the Supreme Court to review a decision made by an appeals court that has made the Hyde Amendment, which addresses gross misconduct on the part of federal prosecutors, virtually meaningless.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Supreme Court should take a case for review to reaffirm the Hyde Amendment, a federal law that checks against gross misconduct by federal prosecutors.

headline.seo: In the Shadows of the High Line

docs.snippet: The High Line has become a tourist-clogged catwalk and a catalyst for some of the most rapid gentrification in the city’s history....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Jeremiah Moss, author of the blog Vanishing New York, criticizes the High Line in New York City, calling it a tourist-clogged catwalk and a catalyst of the most rapid gentrification in the city's history.
docs.lead_paragraph: The High Line has become a tourist-clogged catwalk and a catalyst for some of the most rapid gentrification in the city’s history.
